intro: Sphaeralcea axillaris subsp. violacea, commonly known as the violetstem globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to violet. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
